cyclone.name: IAN
cyclone.current_location: about 255 mi south of Kingston, Jamaica
cyclone.trajectory: Forecast to turn northwest Sunday, then north-northwest across western Cuba late Monday, and move northward through the eastern Gulf toward the Florida peninsula mid-week
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: Florida west coast (likely somewhere between Tampa Bay and the Big Bend) after crossing western Cuba

weather_observation.watch_coast: N/A – no watches posted for Florida as of Advisory #7
weather_observation.warning_coast: N/A – no warnings posted for Florida as of Advisory #7
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Entire Florida peninsula (both Gulf and Atlantic coasts) expected to experience impacts mid-week
weather_observation.wind: Up to a 34% chance of tropical-storm-force winds (≥34 kt) by late Wednesday–Thursday; peak onset probability 18%
weather_observation.storm_surge: None – no surge guidance issued yet for east-central Florida
weather_observation.rainfall: Bands of heavy rain possible late Wednesday into Thursday with localized flooding, but guidance does not yet show >4 inches at Port Canaveral
weather_observation.other_hazards: Dangerous seas and rip currents beginning mid-week could disrupt vessel traffic and cargo operations
